reviewText: From the Wilson County Fairgrounds and Fiddler's Grove Historical Village in Lebanon Tennessee comes the Homecoming Friends surrounding the nighttime campfire, and the fun with family at the fairgrounds.  This is relaxing to listen to the classic gospel and some new to me.  I love this production.This begins with the upbeat and one of my favorite gospel songs, "Jesus Hold My Hand"  written by Albert Brumley, and a new one to me, "Lead Me to the Rock" and "I'd Rather Have Jesus"  spotlights Mary Tom Speer.  This song is done with those perfect harmonies joining  in perfect Gaither singing style.  And, it is not often that we get to hear Donny Sumner, in "The Unclouded Day".And another of my all time favorite is by the Gaither Vocal Band singing "Yes I Know".  The Vocal Band  also sings "Can't Stop Talkin' About Him"  and "Mansion over the Hilltop" that features the beautiful voice of Jeanne Johnson.  And a beautiful song by the nearly 90 year old Eva Mae LeFevre singing  "Leave It There".If you really enjoy the acapella sound, listen how beautiful the Martins sing "Soft and Tenderly".Joining in are the Isaacs "I Found a Way";  The Hoppers "Let the Redeemed Say So" and if you like the fiddle playing, a special treat (The Orange Blossom Special".Some other excellent songs include:  Denomination Blues - Buddy Green;  Touch Me Lord Jesus - Jessy Dixon;  Speak Love - Joey Martin;  Hold Me While I Cry - Karen Peck & New River;  Kum Ba Ya/Take My Hand, Precious Lord - Lynda Randle with her moving soulful voice.The Holy Hills Of Heaven Call Me - Kim Hopper; O, The Blood Of Jesus/Nothing But The Blood/Near The Cross Medley - Friends;  Livin' in the Rain features the Easters.This is a wonderful gathering, new and old songs, the old timers with the younger Homecoming Friends.  The Bonus includes some very interesting interviews with some Friends on being a part of the Gaither videos with Joy Gardner, Stephen Hill, Ann Downing, Larry Ford, Squire Parsons, Eva Mae LeFevre and Mosie ListerFor another gathering that is outside the normal setting, try theBill and Gloria Gaither and Their Homecoming Friends: Homecoming Picnic......Rizzo
summary: Well done, mixture of Friends, Family Fun

reviewText: Always loved the Gaither Homecoming videos and the music.  This one is especially a good one.  This was shipped to me on time and I found it to be in perfect condition.  This seller would certainly get my vote for excellence.

reviewText: As always, the Gaither Group has put together the top of the line.  It seems the entire world has become familiar with Gospel Music.It is amazing that my friends in Ireland and Belgium get to hear the same Quartets and groups that I have loved for many years. Now, Canada and many other nations around the world share God's beautiful music.How about that?

reviewText: The gospel music keeps you uplifted and makes you understand how important music is. The Homecoming DVD's are my favorite ones to watch. The singers are amazing, voices like you angels.

reviewText: For most of us just saying the name "Gaither" is pretty much enough said.  That is true of this dvd.  You'd think, after this many years, of Bill & Gloria doing these videos, that they'd get old.  However, they seem to be getting better to me and God continues to bless their efforts.  Enough said!

reviewText: I have a lot of the Gaither Homecoming DVD's and especially enjoy the ones where it's just the group in a room and specific setting.  Bill does a good job of choosing certain singers for the song they sing.

reviewText: i love this dvd. I love all the songs they sing and what talent they all have. The arrangement of the music is awesome.

reviewText: My husband and I have listened to music by Bill Gaither's group, and those he invites to his "homecoming programs", and we love the message in the music.  It is wonderful to hear such Christian music by all the talented people in the Gaither's programs.  We will never grow tired of it.  And we love having the DVD's available to play when we want to hear the programs.  We are thankful for this type of music.  We are in our late age of life, and it means  a lot to us.
summary: We love and enjoy the Capfire Homecoming recording.

reviewText: Another spectacular production from the long line of Gaither DVD's and Tapes. Good to see these last spectacular piano solos by the late Anthony Burger. He was excellent as ever. Gave it his very all to the end. I admire Sherri Easter for doing the shows at her advanced stage of pregnancy also. This was a great one too. I highly recommend it for the Gaither fans out there, of which I am a big one.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Canadian Homecoming .. This is a recent purchase, and it has been one of the most difficult reviews I have done on these series. Three stars is, of course, not bad at all. // Some of the presentation is great, like The Hoppers' rendition of I'VE COME TOO FAR, which is a really good song and is by a very talented family quartet. THEN CAME THE MORNING, sung by Earnie Haase & Signature Sound, -another outstanding quartet. These songs are not just sung well, they are inspirational. // Another inspirational song on this recording is: THROUGH IT ALL, sung by the -always good- Booth Brothers.The Gaither Vocal Band does MY JOURNEY TO THE SKY. Oh, and I must mention MORE THAN EVER, sung by Russ Taff and The Isaacs. Very touching.One thing that I found a bit annoying was the clapping that accompanied the late Anthony Burger's piano special.  I could have done without that. Also, I will add that, on a great song I mentioned above by The Hoppers, there was maybe a bit too much from the drum section. // I really like drums a lot, but it was dum, dum, etc. over and over. Even so, I still loved the song.One must consider my age, of course, yet I do like many kinds of music.  But for that song, I would have liked the background not quite so repetitious.  // The stage is circular, and there are many sitting on the round, and I saw some some fun with that, that I enjoyed. It is just that some of the pieces were not my favorites.//  And!  ...The reason I am being so critical is probably because I have about fifty six DVDs, and also some CDs by these folks and other members and guests of Bill and Gloria Gaither's recordings. I like some more than others, but would not part with any of these treasures. These are all blessings of various degrees.// There you have it.PMT
summary: One of Gloria and Bill Gaither's creations -

reviewText: Most of the old timers are gone,  but Mary Tom Speer and Eva May both sing in this one.  There are some super performances from a lot of your favorites and a few surprises as well.  Who would have thought to pair the Easters with Ben Speer... but it's great!  It's not a favorite,  but it has some wonderful moments in it.
